section.title: Tutorial 1: Browsing FlyMine - Running a Quick Search
section.para: Quick Search allows you to access all the information that is available for a particular database entry and provides a good way to browse the database. The Quick Search box is found on the top right of the FlyMine home page. You can use this to search for anything with an identifier, symbol or synonym; for example genes, proteins, transcripts or binding sites. Wild cards (*) can be added to increase the range of a quick search.

listitem.para: for A. gambiae genes, use Ensembl identifiers (eg. ENSANGG00000001499).
for Apis mellifera genes, use Ensembl identifiers (eg. ENSAPMG00000012500).
for C. elegans genes, use the WormBase identifiers or symbols (eg. WBGene00003920, par-5, ftt-1).
for proteins, use UniProt identifiers or primary accessions (eg. 18C_DROME, P16909).
for protein domains or families, use InterPro (eg. IPR001254, IPR001804).

section.para: This tutorial will guide you through running a Quick Search. As an example, we will run a Quick Search for the zen gene. Enter the gene symbol 'zen' into the search box and press 'Search'. Since only one item in the database matches the term 'zen', you will be taken straight to the 'Object details page' for the zen gene. Navigating the object details page is described in more detail in Tutorial 2.

Wild cards (*) can be added to increase the range of a quick search. Enter 'zen*' into the search box and press 'Search'. This time the search term matches several items in the database and a summary list of these will be returned as your results.
